dmca.title: Nexus EULA Violation
dmca.body:
Subj: nxAAOClient Browser -- EULA violation  
Date: 7/27/2003 4:39:34 PM Eastern Daylight Time 
From: [PRIVATE]@hotmail.com 
To: [PRIVATE]@hotmail.com, [PRIVATE]@aol.com 
CC: legal@nexussw.com, [PRIVATE]@nexussw.com, clan@armyops.nexussw.com 
Sent from the Internet (Details) 
 


[PRIVATE],

While I don't mind you disclosing the nature of the program (i.e. the 
password data), print-outs of packet sniff logs/captures are in direct 
violation of the software EULA.  It is considered information for "reverse 
engineering" and contains proprietary formatted data for the software and is 
NOT public domain.

http://www.10thsfg.net/php_files/invboard/index.php?showtopic=3785&st=0&#entry23

I must ask that you remove the packet traces from that url, all the other 
comments I don't care about, but like I mentioned the packet traces are 
against the EULA.  Aside from all that I really wished you would have 
contacted me prior to freaking out on this issue.  We have a reason for 
collecting the information that we do.

After our initial discussions I assumed we had a working relationship to 
foster a successful release and continued future releases of this software.  
However it appears that you "turn on a dime" and well, that's your 
perogative, but I guess I'm dissapointed in your lack of support.  I 
would've expected someone who endorsed the software so heavily to come to me 
to resolve issues you had with it, not just blast your horns.

Thank you for the support and please let me know when the packet snif logs 
have been removed from your forums.

[private], CTO
Nexus Software, Inc.
[PRIVATE]@nexussw.com

CC: legal department; clan@armyops.nexussw.com

_________________________________________________________________

http://join.msn.com/?page=features/junkmail
